martin.benuska wrote:
>
> Hello,
>
> sorry for newbie question, but is it possible to configure filter to
> accept only sites with specific encoding ? like ISO-8859-1 etc. ?
>






Not really.  Encoding, if specified, is done on a page by page basis in 
the HTTP response header and/or in HEAD of the HTML page.  You could set 
a mid-fetch filter to look at the former.  For the latter, you would 
need to probably make your own processor that parsed the HTML HEAD Meta 
info to find encoding (our ExtractorHTML doesn't look for this info IIRC).

Better would be to not rely on either.  They can disagree and often are 
incorrect.  Better to make a processor that does charset recognition 
(We've been talking about doing such a thing for a while now: 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=899909&group_id=73833&atid=539102).  
Then, you could add a filter that ran after the charset guesser to 
filter out encodings not wanted.

St.Ack
